Identification.LongTitle: Exemptions from and Modifications to Hours of Work Provisions Regulations

Provision.Text: Whereas the Governor in Council is of the opinion that the application of certain provisions of Division I of Part III of the Canada Labour Codea, without modification, to certain classes of employees who are employed in or in connection with the operation of certain industrial establishments would be or is unduly prejudicial to the interests of the employees in those classes or would be or is seriously detrimental to the operation of those industrial establishments;
And whereas the Governor in Council is satisfied that certain provisions of Division I of Part III of the Canada Labour Codea cannot reasonably be applied to certain classes of employees;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Labour, pursuant to paragraphs 175(1)(a)b and (b)c and subsection 270(1)d of the Canada Labour Codea, makes the annexed Exemptions from and Modifications to Hours of Work Provisions Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Canada Labour Code.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Road Transportation Sector and Postal and Courier Sector

Section.Text: This Part applies to persons who are employed in the road transportation sector or the postal and courier sector.

The following employees in the road transportation sector who operate a motor vehicle that is used to transport goods and that has a gross combination weight rating in excess of 4 500 kg are exempt from the application of sections 169.1, 169.2, 173.01 and 173.1 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: city motor vehicle operators, as defined in section 2 of the Motor Vehicle Operators Hours of Work Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: highway motor vehicle operators, as defined in section 2 of those Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The following employees in the postal and courier sector who operate a motor vehicle that is used to transport mail or parcels are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: city motor vehicle operators, as defined in section 2 of the Motor Vehicle Operators Hours of Work Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: highway motor vehicle operators, as defined in section 2 of those Regulations.

Subsection.Text: With respect to employees referred to in subsection (1), subsection 169.1(1) of the Act is modified as follows:

Every employee is entitled to and shall be granted an unpaid break of at least 30 minutes for every period of five consecutive hours of work. The employer may grant this break at any time during the work period or shift and it may be divided into periods of at least 15 minutes. If the employer requires the employee to be at their disposal during the break period, the employee is to be paid for the break.
Motor coach operators who are not employed by a municipal or provincial transit authority are exempt from the application of sections 169.1, 169.2, 173.01 and 173.1 of the Act.
For the purpose of this section, motor coach means a bus that is designed for intercity passenger transport and that is not equipped with features to accommodate standing passengers.

Section.Text: Armoured car crew members are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.
The following employees are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: warehouse workers who handle, move, load and unload materials by hand or by means of material handling equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shippers; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: receivers.

Section.Text: Dispatchers are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.
Mechanics are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.
This Part applies to persons who are employed in the marine sector.

Subsection.Text: Dockworkers, longshore persons, shiploader operators, stevedores, barge loaders, boat loaders, dock hands, dockpersons, lumpers, checkers, planners, tower loader operators, wharfpersons, tanker loaders, machinery operators, stowers, tradespersons, marine agents, dispatchers and mechanics who are employed in long-shoring operations are exempt from the application of sections 173.01 and 173.1 of the Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Modifications — subsection 169.1(1) and section 169.2 of the Act
Subsection.Text: With respect to employees referred to in subsection (1),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 169.1(1) of the Act is modified as follows:

Subsection.Text: Every employee is entitled to and shall be granted an unpaid break of at least 30 minutes for every period of five consecutive hours of work. The employer may grant the break at any time during the work period or shift and it may be divided into periods of at least 15 minutes. If the employer requires the employee to be at their disposal during the break period, the employee is to be paid for the break.

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 169.2(1) of the Act is modified as follows:

Subsection.Text: Every employee is entitled to and shall be granted a rest period of at least eight consecutive hours during each 24-hour period in which they work a work period or shift.

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 169.2(2) of the English version of the Act is modified as follows:

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), an employer may require that an employee work additional hours to their scheduled work periods or shifts, which would result in them having a rest period of fewer than eight consecutive hours during each 24-hour period in which they work a work period or shift, if it is necessary for the employee to work in order to deal with a situation that the employer could not have reasonably foreseen and that presents or could reasonably be expected to present an imminent or serious

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: threat to the life, health or safety of any person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: threat of damage to or loss of property; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: threat of serious interference with the ordinary working of the employer’s industrial establishment.

Subsection.Text: Forepersons, foreperson checkers, walking bosses, head checkers and terminal planners who are employed in long-shoring operations are exempt from the application of sections 169.2, 173.01 and 173.1 of the Act.
With respect to employees referred to in subsection (1), subsection 169.1(1) of the Act is modified as follows:

The employer may grant the break at any time during the work period or shift and it may be divided into periods of at least 15 minutes. If the employer requires the employee to be at their disposal during the break period, the employee is to be paid for the break.
The following employees who are employed on board a vessel are exempt from the application of sections 173.01 and 173.1 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: masters;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: deck officers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: engineering officers;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: radio operators;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: electrotechnical officers; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ratings.

Section.Text: This Part applies to persons who are employed in the grain sector.
Elevator operators, inland terminal elevator operators and port terminal elevator operators who are employed in grain handling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Railcar spotters, warehouse workers and grain receivers
Section.Text: Railcar spotters, warehouse workers and grain receivers who are employed in grain handling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Millwrights, electricians, power engineers and welders
Section.Text: Millwrights, electricians, power engineers and welders who are employed in grain handling or grain milling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.
Laboratory technicians and laboratory supervisors who are employed in grain handling or grain milling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Grading, quality assurance and inspection of grain
Section.Text: Employees who are involved in the grading, quality assurance and inspection of grain and who are employed in grain handling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.
Grain cleaning operators who are employed in grain milling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Millers, assistant millers and other operators
Section.Text: Millers, assistant millers, packing equipment operators and bulk load out operators who are employed in grain milling facilities are exempt from the application of section 173.1 of the Act.
